Description: Twenty-four sherds of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl, reconstructed to form a single large fragment with a minimal gap; one handle root preserved. Interior glazed save for band near rim and a tondo; added decorative friezes divided by red bands lined in white: white rosettes; incised lotus and bud; stopt maeander; tongues. In tondo two lines and a metopal frieze of crosses and boxes. Outside, pendant lotus under handle flanked by leaf, volute and palmette;from the rim down: black-figured lions attacking a bull; key band; goats looking back; lotus and bud frieze; rays and rosettes. Dedicatory graffito over rim decoration.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.244, no.15)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 18 no. U1, p. 20, pl. VII, 9 and XXXIII, no. 220)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 661, no. 181)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1077)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no. 1015, pl. 125)
